Reviews.Title: “Fab Family Friendly Hotel for Visiting London”
Reviews.Author: Michelle415
Reviews.Content: We were after a cheap hotel whilst visiting London with our three children, 1yr, 4yr and 6yr. Being our first stay in a premier inn, we didn't know what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was plenty big enough, we had a corner family room - 1 mahoosive bed, 2 small doubles, and a cot, was on the 6th floor, so nice and quiet. Food was lovely, we had dinner and breakfast, both meals were good value for money, and really, really nice. Staff were friendly, although they had said about an easter egg hunt to my son, but there was no evidence of it in the morning :( - wasn't expecting anything tbh, but 6 year olds remember (and go on about) easter egg hunts!! Good position in which to explore the city by, tube station a couple of minutes walk away, and the staff were helpful when we needed advise. The thing that I liked the best is that it's no extra for families, than it would be for a couple, and this goes for all ppremier inns so I believe. Also kids breakfast was free (max 2 per 1 paying adult) Feel like we got a bargain, and in london, that's a bonus!! Will definatly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Kerrelor
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. Only 3 or 4 minutes walk from nearest tube station, pleasant views from high floors. Staff very pleasant and helpful on desk and in restaurant. Lovely food, both dinner and breakfast. Meal deal good value for London. A little way out from Centre of London - just under 20 minutes on the tube to London Victoria - but price reflects this. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Service”
Reviews.Author: BigAl1989
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the hotel (2/4/12) for a night I was pleased with the service me and my mate received. The staff were helpful in information about meal times and car parking arrangements, not to mention they were friendly and positive, we were happy to leave the staff a tip after we had our meal. Would recommend staying here I know if I go to London again I will be. Very ideal location with the tube station literally around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: penelopepitstop66
Reviews.Content: Good all round accommodation. Friendly staff. Excellent breakfast.Hammersmith PI is near to tube,shops at Hammersmith. Park, river and pubs nearby. Hammersmith Apollo just up the road. Great for short break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harrydavy
Reviews.Content: Good location Nice & clean Good service Only negative is it would be better if it had an adjoining pub rather than the little room that comprises bar & resturant ( but I guess there wasn't the room to do so). Overall very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for gigs to the HMV Hammersmith Apollo, and for commuting into central London.”
Reviews.Author: Irene D
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at this particular Premier Inn, but the warm welcome I received upon arrival far out-matched that of previous Premier Inns I'd stayed at! The room I had was very, very small in comparison to other PI's, and the single beds had been pushed together, due to the small space...but the room was very clean and well maintained, as usual for PI's.. The hotel is well positioned for walking to the HMV Hammersmith Apollo (approx 15 minutes stroll away), and I didn't feel unsafe doing this walk alone gone midnight... Its also ideal to use as a base to venture into central London, as there are 3 mainline stations nearby - with Ravenscourt Road station being the nearest (about 5 mins away). The only other niggles I had (apart from the small room size), were small things...only one chair in the room (when it was a twin, so one of us had to perch on one of the beds)...noisy students running up and down the corridor...no double glazing (so let road noise etc in)...and was woken up one night by the couple next door having sex! Haha - yeah, the walls are PRETTY thin!!! :D :D And the car park is TINY!!! Apart from these minor gripes, this hotel offers a great location for getting out and about in London, and is brilliant for going to the Hammersmith if you've a gig on (like I had)...and the attitude of the staff makes up for these moans too - they're all really friendly and helpful and were genuinely interested in what I had been doing that day etc. I'd definately use the Hammersmith Premier Inn again - its just a shame the small room etc dulled the shine on what would have been my best Premier Inn stay to date!

Reviews.Title: “You get what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: dollydollop
Reviews.Content: A standard Premier Inn so you know what to expect when you open the door. The soundproofing could be improved as we could hear next door's TV from 6am and noisy aircon fan in our room. Location perfect for us as we went to the Hammersmith Apollo.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for families visiting London”
Reviews.Author: tmm01
Reviews.Content: Have stayed twice, each time in a family room. Ideal to get into London via tube. Boys enjoyed their stay (6yrs & 8yrs). Family friendly. Clean. Only not much parking, and you have to pay for it - still cheaper than parking in London. A great budget stay for a family. Would recommend. We use it each time we visit the Capital, we come from the SW so ideal motorway links and easy to drive to, if you don't like driving right into London.

Reviews.Title: “does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: TheNorthernTrainMan
Reviews.Content: A couple of minutes walk from Ravenscourt Park tube this hotel is easy to find. If driving there isn't much of a car park. I booked 2 single rooms at the weekend but we both had double beds which was great as I'm 6ft 5in! Room was small with modern decor - this was fine as all I needed was somewhere to wash and sleep. Everything worked, bed was comfortable and clean, bathroom was tiny as was the shower - any larger boys & girls beware! Plenty of hot water. Overall cleanliness was very good (I do have a habit of checking for dust on top of wardrobes etc - v sad!) Shower unit could have done with a few more minutes cleaning attention around the base but I'm being picky. There was some traffic noise but many locations in london you will get this particularly as I had to sleep with the window open as the room was so warm. No aircraft or tube noise and as there are only 10 or so rooms on each floor wasn't disturbed by doors banging or folk passing by on the corridor. Overall a good hotel matching PI's marketing. Hammersmith was a 10 minute walk - handy for bars and shops. I'd recommend it if what you are looking for is a quality budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fine place”
Reviews.Author: MohammedJaffar
Reviews.Content: good place close to the tube station. most important on the Piccadilly line. On the other side is the heathrow airport connections. can get to central london in minutes thru the tube. good hotel, ambiance too...

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMR31
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Premier Inn in Hammersmith, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. The building, from the outside, is not inspiring (but is easy to spot), a great concrete high rise, but then I was staying in it, not looking at it! There were some security measures in place (you had to use your room key to access the accommodation floors) which helped make me feel safe and secure. The hotel was well maintained and comfortable. The room I had was very small, although I expected nothing else for the price in London. It was fine for me, but a couple would have struggled a bit. The double bed was pushed up against one wall and floor space was minimal - there would have been a lot of edging past one another! The room was clean and well presented, and it had secondary double glazing to help deaden the noise from outside. The bed was what I would class as 'all right' - it certainly could have been a bit firmer but it was by no means was the worst I have ever experienced. The shower room was also clean. Again, it was small, and had no bath, but the water pressure was fantastic. Breakfast was fine, although some Premier Inns give a wider choice of breakfast, space in the dining room was constrained. Above all, the staff were fantastic - all very helpful and courteous. The hotel is roughly 200 yards from a tube station. All for £50 for the night (paid in advance, double if you wanted the flexiility to cancel). What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Rugby fan visiting the Twickenham Stoop for Premier division game Harlequins vs Worcester Warriors”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently situated to visit my niece and watch the rugby. stayed 4 nights, staff excellent room a little cramped but overall very enjoyable. Good facilities should they be needed. I have stayed at the Hammersmith on two ocassions recently and would always recommemd it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Convienent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clairedScotland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Premier Inn for one night. I choose because of the location - I wanted something in Hammersmith. It is very close to the tube station if you did want to travel into central London, and there are several restaurant / bars nearby. From the outside it looks really ugly, however as soon as you are inside you get a lovely welcome from the reception team. I would recommend a room on the top floor (12th floor). I had a corner room and the views were amazing - also it was really quiet. The room was as expected for a Premier Inn, so I was happy with this and the facilities. I did eat in the restaurant (mainly as I didnt have much time), however I probably wouldnt do this again. The soup (smoked tomato) was asty but so boiling hot it had to have been heated up in a microwave. It was unbelievably hot - so took quite a while to eat. This meant (I think ) my main course sat on a hot plate for a long time: I had a special salmon with caper sauce, brocolli and new potatoes. Sounded nice but was all overcooked. In summary - would I stay here again? If I needed to be in Hammersmith yes, but if I was visiting London on holiday I would want to be closer to the centre. I would eat in one of the several restaurants nearby for evening meal and there are a few coffee shops / cafes that I would go to instead for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly on the outside, beautiful within!”
Reviews.Author: LintonWood
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with a colleague while on a recent business trip to London. While not the most attractive building in the chain, it offers a clean and friendly base for such an excursion. Be aware that parking is very limited – only about two dozen spaces at a cost of £15 per night. We were also warned not to leave valuables in the car overnight! The reception area is spacious and has seats and tables where guests can hold an informal meeting or gather to chat before going out. The bar and restaurant area is immediately adjacent to reception and fairly small by the standards of Premier Inn, but very clean and well laid out. All staff members that we encountered were very friendly, efficient and well trained. The hotel is thirteen storeys high and there are certain security measures in place that suggest there may have been issues with unwanted guests in the past. That said, my colleague and I wandered up to a local pub and felt safe enough. While my room was unconventionally shaped, everything was exactly as it should be and I enjoyed a comfortable night. The shower was very powerful with lashings of hot water and the air conditioning could be easily adjusted. I didn’t have my evening meal at the hotel but the breakfast was fabulous – Premier Inn at its best with a proper buffet – all a hungry businessman could want to start his day. All-in-all I would be happy to recommend this hotel to fellow travellers and would have no problems staying there again when next in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Lone traveller made to feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Sandandseaforme
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between a business meeting in central London one day and a private event in Richmond the following day due to it's location and cost compared to other Premier Inns in the area. It's easy to find and just two minutes from Ravenscourt Park tube. The room was smaller than I've enjoyed at other Premier Inns but had everything I expected & needed. Even a good full-length mirror with excellent lighting and a hair dryer with a long cable. I was shattered after a very long and busy day. All I wanted was a bite to eat and go to bed. I went to eat in the restaurant, I was asked how many the table was for. I replied that it was just me and saw I was the only one in the place. The manager replied that I was not on my own as he & the waiter would look after me. I thought that was a lovely touch. I felt a bit guilty when I saw I could have pizza in my room. But I still ordered one, with a side salad and a bottle of wine. It was all nicely wrapped with a selection of condiments within a short time. The waiter offered to carry it to my room - I declined as a few people had started to arrive. I slept like a log and heard no noise in the corridor even though I was by the doors/lift. Breakfast was a buffet but with poached/boiled eggs/porridge on request. There was no queuing to make toast, pour drinks etc. and I only waited a few minutes for my poached eggs. I don't know what some people expect. But the couple on the table next to me moaned that the buffet was not fresh and food had been hanging about. It was not and had not - the food was not piled high and was being refreshed regularly as it was in small containers and the place was full of people wanting the full English. Mind you, they also complained the coffee cups were too big, the tea cups too small and the toast tasteless! For me it was another enjoyable stay in a Premier Inn where good customer service comes as standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Janey-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring London. Found the staff extremely friendly & helpful, stress free check in & out. Our room very clean, fluffy towels & bed very comfortable. No traffic noise, we had a room just by the lift & no noise from that either. Near some good restaurants & bars. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on the whole”
Reviews.Author: MrsChrisW
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean hotel with pleasant staff. The one downside was that I had book a disabled room and was given a non disabled one, apparantly I should have mentioned this again at check in. As by the time I realised I had been given the wrong room I was dog tired and on the 10th floor I did not make an issue but was told the next day had I raised it I could have been moved. The problem was not significant as I was only there one night but it would have been had I been staying longer. The breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: catmac25
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, the hotel really nice, staff pleasant and helpful and the restaurant is also great to eat in with a good kid's menu. You can always rely on getting clean rooms in this hotel and Hammersmith is a good place to stay with the hotel only a couple of minutes from the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: PBS01
Reviews.Content: As a group of 4 girls staying away in London for the weekend, we requested our rooms be near each-other and they did just that- next door in fact. Room was spotlessly tidy and a separate bathroom and a television with lots of channels including music and radio channels to have as background noise when getting ready, Lovely comfy beds and lots of mirrors and light. Not bothered once by staff and enjoyed it very much. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Family break in London”
Reviews.Author: Helen S
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, the hotel clean and breakfast decent. Great base for exploring London as tube station few minutes walk up the road and the hotel was half the price of a hotel based in central London. Just a shame there aren't more parking spaces.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: moondiva33
Reviews.Content: everything about this hotel was excellent.... from the fantastic service, to the outstanding breakfast!! my family enjoyed a hassle free stay, and would highly recommend anybody looking to stay in london to stay here. we would def stay again, in a heartbeat. nothing was too much trouble, Nathan on the front desk was lovely and went out of his way to help on everything.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Rooms but avoid the restuarant!!!”
Reviews.Author: Helen C
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfortable although as a family of 5 we had to book 2 rooms (which were booked at the same time). Unfortunately they put us on 2 different floors which meant the kids had to go between the 2!! The kids meals in the restuarant were not good, especially the spag bol!! Service was very slow and the meals came with 15 minutes between the first 2 and the last 3. Not ideal when you want to eat as a family. The reception staff were very rude and the Duty manager was full of excuses about the poor food and the slow service. It was in a great location with the nearest tube station being a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “stronglt reccomend”
Reviews.Author: john w
Reviews.Content: hard to fault this as a destination people. Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms, decent breakfast. My missus was disappointed she wasn't staying at the Dorchester at first, but even she thought it was good. We were on a family trip to London for a couple of days. One nights stay with breakfast for 4 with parking and wi fi, less than £150? Good value i think. Tube station, district line just across the road

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: burchybabes
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, friendly to kids, centrally located overall great place to stay for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: Other trip adviser entries are correct. Don't be fooled by the old fashioned outwards appearance of the hotel - it is worth the mooney and the staff are extremely friendly

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Neil F
Reviews.Content: Travel to London 3-4 times a year. This is by far the best I have stayed in regardless of the price. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, attentive and helpful staff and very quiet and comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: LynseyBrown
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasently surprised with the high level of customer service, very tasty and well cooked food and quiet comfortable rooms I experienced during my stay at this hotel. Good value for money despite it's London position.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Taffy&Yorkie
Reviews.Content: Hello, I'll keep this short as the hotel is a premier inn and yes it ticks all the usual premier inn standards, the hotel looks a bit run down externally but don't let that worry you, the rooms and hotel are fresh. The hotel is out of London so unless your using it like us for the apollo then it's a visit to the nearby tube station and a short journey into the capital. Harrods is only a few stops away. The thing that makes this hotel the best premier inn we have ever stopped in is the staff, there all friendly, professional and give you that bit extra customer care, they can't be faulted. The food, service and general atmosphere in this place is fantastic. I for one will be staying here again even though it's a it out of town it's worth the bit extra journey time, thanks P.I. Onee fault is the car park, basically there's the smallest car park with a dozen or so places, at fifteen quid it's pricey as well but if your like us and you have a young family then a car in the car park is just a bit of added help, get here early!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but sort the car park out”
Reviews.Author: claytoncast
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat Premier Inn for simple value and efficiency Although we live in South London, we stayed here for a night as we had work entailing an early start in West London. Big room, clean, good breakfast, and a great location just 2 min walk from the tube. As always the staff were very keen and helpful. Just a couple of points. You do sell yourselves as a business hotel during the week Premier Inn, so get it together and offer free Wi-Fi. It wouldn't cost you anything and if McDonald's can do it, I'm sure you can. Also need to sort out your car park charges at the one in Hammersmith. You have very limited parking and charge £15 for a 24-hour period. This is slightly ridiculous as nobody ever really stays in your hotels for 24 hours. What about charging £10 for up to 12 hours. Incidentally for anyone staying here, although the receptionist didn't know this, there is plenty of parking in the side streets which is free after 6 PM and doesn't start again the following morning until 9 AM so you got an early departure no need to give Premier Inn anything for their overpriced car park. In the main though, great stay. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and - for London - cheap”
Reviews.Author: Scottso
Reviews.Content: Good for business traveler, or family looking for no frills accomodation. 2 minutes to underground

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the "packaging".”
Reviews.Author: DesertQueen07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in December. I needed a basic hotel in the Hammersmith area and this fit my location requirements and budget. First visit to Premier Inn. Efficient check in, friendly staff who explained that the car parking was first come, first serve even if I had paid for 2 nights parking. So they advised me to leave car in car park unless I needed it as they could not guarantee me a space the second night. No problem for me, so I left the car there. Nice of them to explain this as I was about to leave in the car, I then had the opportunity to change my mind without having lost the space. Rooms are basic but very good beds for a budget hotel. Small but have all you need. Very clean and as I was on 4th floor, no issue with street noise. Close to Hammersmith Broadway which has 4 tube lines. Safe to walk from tube to hotel after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Hammersmith Premier Inn”
Reviews.Author: N W
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff always willing to help. Booked a family room and we were given a double bed, a temporary bed and a mattress on the floor, I raised this with the desk and we got a second temporary bed pretty quickly. Would have preferred proper beds however but the room wasn't really big enough to accommodate. Overall however the stay was very good - would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: will_dick
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hammersmith Premier Inn and can thoroughly recommend this hotel to others. It is very well situated and provides an excellent room with a very comfortable bed and a clean and functional bathroom. The staff were very kind and went out of their way to make us feel very much at home. We will use this hotel every time we visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Maris M
Reviews.Content: Given the price level in an otherwise expensive city - London, PI Hammersmith provided excellent service and facilities for a reasonable price. Liked the view from my 10th floor room. The greatest asset of the hotel is perhaps the professionaal and friendly staff - who really 'go the extra mile' for the guests. Thanks a lot for that!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met”
Reviews.Author: Alessandro T
Reviews.Content: Accomodation, service and lunch were meeting our expectations. The balance between quality and price was right and we had a pleasant experience. The hotel is well located and it is easy to reach the very city centre in about half an hour by tube. It is a valuable solution for family and young travellers.

Reviews.Title: “graduation party”
Reviews.Author: Kerttu K
Reviews.Content: Everyhing OK. Location very good and we had a big room. though very windy on the 11th floor but the view was magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory.”
Reviews.Author: CJ H
Reviews.Content: Nothing special, but no complaints. Well, almost. I did book a table for dinner and on check-in was told that the restaurant was closed for the day (christmas day). I wasn't very impressed about that as they sent me a text CONFIRMING that my table had been reserved. But apart from that the quality of the accommodation was good, although the room was unusually small. Breakfast was good. Very good for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: UandB
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable price, but probably the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. As we were only there for one night it was fine, as the bed was big and comfortable and the room very clean. Very close to a tube station and the High Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: niamhoreardon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 others. We had two twin rooms that were small but very comfortable. We stayed for two nights and had breakfast on 1 morning in the hotel. The breakfast itself was delicious. The overall thing for me was the service. The staff that work at this hotel we excellent. They were very helpful on all notes from helping us out with directions etc, to helping you out in every aspect of our stay. I could not have a asked for any more from them, they are a credit to the hotel. All in all our stay was brilliant and I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone staying in London. It is close to 2 tube stations that will bring you into the centre of London, but the Hammersmith high street has nearly everything you need from shopping to eating. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service that will knock your socks off”
Reviews.Author: CazzaJoe
Reviews.Content: Whilst the outside doesn't look much the warm welcome inside more than makes up for it. The staff were professional but warm and friendly. The breakfast buffet was plentiful, hot and great quality and dinner was was simple but tasty. We had not stayed at a Premier Inn before and were pleasantly surprised. It was in a great location- a couple of minutes walk to a tube station very clean. The one thing missing...Lenny Henry

Reviews.Title: “Great location - easy to get to and convenient to travel to city centre from here”
Reviews.Author: mnd316
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we chose this place because we had tickets to see Ed Byrne at the Hammersmith Apollo. We had never stayed here before - choosing to stay more in the city centre when visiting previously. I was really pleased that we drove here quickly, avoiding traffic and congestion charges. There is a small car park that you pay for extra to your room charge - get here early though because it is small. The room we had was clean but very small for a double. The windows were old but had excellent secondary glazing that meant the room was very quiet. We didn't eat here - the restaurant served the standard menu but was very small and the breakfast choice in particular looked limited. The main high street however has excellent range of cafes and pubs and restaurants. In particular we found a Wetherspoon pub where the beer and food were excellent. It is a great location - easy walking distance to the Apollo and only a few minutes to the nearest tube station which we used to access the whole of London. One tip here - get an Oyster card, it's so much easier than buying tickets each journey.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced tat”
Reviews.Author: apachenation
Reviews.Content: the worst and overpriced hotel we have ever stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Short but relaxing and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: KilkennyPiscean
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a comfortable and safe budget option. I stayed with 2 teenagers and we were very comfortable. The breakfast is excellent - good selection and value for money. The room was bright and the bed very comfortable. It was quiet too.

Reviews.Title: “Joseph Delicata”
Reviews.Author: Joseph D
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Premier Inn in Hammersmith, I spent a week last August while I was on a business trip and I enjoyed the stay so much that I chose this Hotel again this time for Christmas shopping with my wife. The hotel is situated in superb area: it is just across the road from Ravenscourt Park Station and situated in King Street in which you can find International Banks, Dry Cleaning Shops, High Class and Budget Restaurants, Car Rentals & Taxis Services Office, Cinema Halls, Bars and everything that you might need (even an ironmongery to by padlocks for my suitcases). The room and bath room were spotless. The room had coffee and tea making facilities, the bed had a comfortable mattress and smooth new bed sheets. Hand washing soap, shower gels and bright white towels are provided daily in the bathroom. However staff are probably the Hotel’s best asset they are remarkable Nice, Helpful and Great to talk to. They even allowed us to stay late at our room (till 6.00 pm instead of 12.00 pm) at a ridiculously minimum charge which we greatly appreciated. I strongly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster!!”
Reviews.Author: RFresh_31
Reviews.Content: Cool name very bad standards!! In my case the hotel managed to make my yearly trip to UK and first ever trip with the whole family in UK a complete flop! I have pointed out issues concerning the hotel room on my second day of stay and nothing was rectified, also have specifically stressed another issue that have arise after my first complaint with another member of the staff, but again at no avail, on my check out I was asked if I had a pleasant and PREMIER stay, you can imagine my feed back at 3:00 am, the receptionist have excused him self on behalf of the hotel operation for the inconvenience caused and tried to handle the situation that was a disaster for 6 nights by ofering a refund for one night! can you just believe that! whatever!! I am disgusted with the way PREMIER INN have managed my situation and ruined my whole experience in UK! P.S last year have stayed in the same street in the Holiday Inn Express Hotel, I'm not saying that all was flawless but at least cleaning was 99%, food 90% total defenitly better then Premier INN or better OUT. Disappointment, disaster and catastrophe are small words to describe how upset I am.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the London Marathon...”
Reviews.Author: Jon B
Reviews.Content: It's nowhere near the start line but the travel links from almost outside the hotel are very, very good - it's right by Ravenscourt Park tube station, but is also just five minutes walk from Hammersmith tube, and you can get anywhere in London from Hammersmith! Very nice staff, rooms were just what you would expect, only thing is the weekend prices are a bit high.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with our stay at Premier Inn, Hammersmith”
Reviews.Author: Orlabaj
Reviews.Content: Travelled to London in October -two adults and two older teenagers. We had a budget in mind for a hotel and I spent hours on the internet looking at what was available. I finally chose the Premier Inn above a guest house. I am so glad that we did. Could not believe the size of the room that we had with fantastic huge windows. Hotel is spotlessly clean and the breakfast was fabulous but I would go early if you can as gets a little crowded near the end of breakfast time.The staff were lovely and so helpful particularly the staff who work in the bar/dining areas. The hotel is in a fairly good position also - a straight road to the nearest tube station. Fabulous - I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for such great service”
Reviews.Author: 4evaLFC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night of a football match with my daughter. I drove down and found the hotel very easy to find being just off the A4. We got the last parking space which we were chuffed about. Parking cost £15 for 24 hrs which is really good value for London and meant we could go shopping the next day without having to move the car. All the staff we encountered smiled in greeting, were smart and professionally dressed and were helpful in explaining anything we wanted to know. Whole place very clean and our room had a very comfy bed and extra pillows with a good view of the TV to watch football highlights on our return. Perfect. Makes a nice change that the mirror and plug socket were next to each other for ease of drying my hair. Location was spot on as only 3 minutes walk to the tube for going to the match and central London for shopping. Cafes and restaurants in immediate area and a Tesco Express 4 minute walk away. All you can eat buffet breakfast was lovely, really good selection, hot food was hot and fresh and continental choices on top looked fresh too. It cost £8.50 but my daughter ate for free being only 15 so represented great value. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for London”
Reviews.Author: MattandAmyG
Reviews.Content: This is a great choice if you fly into Heathrow but want to hang out downtown without having to sell a kidney to do it. If you try to stay in or near downtown London, you'll either pay a fortune for a room, or you'll risk staying in a filthy and/or noisy dump. This hotel gives a nice balance. It is conveniently located about halfway between Heathrow and downtown and is about a two minute walk from a Tube station with easy access to the airport and to downtown (District Line). The staff was helpful and friendly. We arrived at about 1 a.m., and the woman at the front desk cheerfully welcomed us, and since we hadn't eaten anything that evening, she helped us order pizza at a reasonable price. The room wasn't fancy, but it was very good for the price. It was average-sized for Europe (meaning small compared with a U.S. hotel room), though the bathroom was somewhat large for Europe and surprisingly had counter space (rare for Europe). It had a comfortable bed (especially the duvet), had heating and air conditioning, had a HDTV, had a great view, and was immaculately clean. The few drawbacks - the cable TV had very limited options (in case you're one of the few people who travels to Europe to watch TV - we aren't), Wi-Fi was a little pricey (though it was faster than what I'm accustomed to in hotels), and the elevator doesn't go to the top floor. Accordingly, if you're on the top floor (which we were), then you have to take the elevator up and then climb a flight of stairs. Overall, these were minor drawbacks, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Premium price for very small old fashioned room”
Reviews.Author: Eimeark13
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many premier Inns over the past few years and always been satisfied, but this time i paid a much higher rate (because it was London) but was very disappointed. I expected to at least have a decent size room with similar decor standards to that of other premier Inns - because of the price i paid. I did not think it was value for money at all, it felt claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and affordable comfort”
Reviews.Author: geolon
Reviews.Content: This would make an excellently affordable base for a trip to London. It's on the right side of London for Heathrow, has Tube stations in easy reach, a wide range of reasonable and ethnically diverse restaurants nearby and well as pubs, cafes and a large shopping centre several blocks west. It's situated in a very safe area, opposite an attractive park and near enough to the Thames for a pleasant walk along the riverfront. I got a ninth floor room with stunning views (unusual for a budget London hotel), and a spotless, compact but very pleasant room, that felt like a good deal for the money. The receptionist gave me a very nice welcome (I think she was called Mariana) and I felt confident that if I had any problems (I didn't) they would be effectively dealt with. I did not try the in-house catering as I was on my way to hospital and not allowed to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to meet up”
Reviews.Author: Linda A
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel recently. A few of us met up from all ends of the country and found it to be convenient and welcoming with a wide selection of pubs and restaurants nearby, as well as a nice bar at the Premier Inn itself. If you do stay, it's definitely worth having the breakfast, best one I've had in ages and a lot less than you normally pay.

Reviews.Title: “The staff in this Premier Inn were delightful!”
Reviews.Author: Signalfixer123
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity of a night out in Hammersmith so I booked a room in the Hammersmith Premier Inn. I wasn't too sure what to expect, because when I got off the bus, the Premier Inn was towering high in the sky in the near distance. As I got closer, I could see that it was a very old building, possibly ex Council offices, so I climbed up the stairs and in to a seating area with trepidation. Down some stairs was the reception desk with what looked like two positions, both of which were manned and busy. To the left of reception was a small bar. Once it was my turn to check in, I was very pleasantly surpirsed at how friendly and professional my welcome was. Power to your elbow R.K, you explained everything to me as I would expect to hear it. You told me about the Good Night Guarantee, what time the breakfast was served and even introduced me to your colleague at reception. I was allocated a room on the 13th floor and here I have a word of caution. The lift only goes up to floor 12, so if you are old or have loads of luggage this is not the floor for you! Before I went out for the evening I decided to give the bar a try and on offer and available were Stella Artois and Carlsberg which equates to a 100% availability of lagers offered. What really surprised me was the price for a pint of Stella, where I was charged £3.20. Now this is 35p cheaper than another Premier Inn that I recently stayed in. I decided to have a couple more pints before I left and again, the barman was great. He was attentive and on top of his job. On my return, I had another couple of pints and again, the barman was good and at the end of his shift, he even took the time out to say goodnight to the three of us that were sat at the bar. Something that is sadly lacking in the majority of hotels. Unfortunately though, all was not well and I had the following issues which I discussed with the manager the next morning.I was allocated a room on the 13th floor and the room was the closest room to the lift machine room and all night long I listened to the drone of lift machinery. Also the room was cold, so I turned the air conditioning on by using the control on the wall that looked like it had come out of the Ark. Having said that, it was fit for purpose but when the air conditioning started its heating cycle it began to make noises like running water-a bit like sitting next to a fountain. So I turned the air conditioning off and resorted to turning on the convector heater that had been provided. This was not, unfortunately, enough to overcome the gale that was blowing under the door. Otherwise, although very dated the room was O.K. In the morning I ventured down to the ground floor for breakfast and was amazed at how small in proportion to the whole establishment the main eating area was. But again, if it was not for the efficient way the breakfast staff buzzed around, the room would have got clogged up. The staff kept on top of clearing the tables and did well at keeping the guests flowing through the small area. I want to point out before I write any more that I am not a freeloader looking for a free room but I felt compelled to speak to the duty manager about my experience in my room and straight away, without any hesitation I was offered a refund. I declined the refund on the basis that all I wanted to do was to point out the areas of my stay that didn't delight me. The guy wrote down my comments in a notebook that he got out of his pocket and I am confident that he will follow through on the assurances he gave me regarding addressing my issues. He did, however, offer to book me a taxi to Kings Cross station at the hotel's cost which I accepted. The guy that dealt with me was Ash and I would like to say thank you for the professional way you dealt with me. So take note, Premier Inn, here you have a hotel where the staff are a credit to you. It's just a pity that this model does not extend to some of your other hotels. I would most certainly stay here again, but not in that room!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was near Westfield Shopping Centre and the Ideal Home Xmas show at Earls Court. The nearest tube was only 300 metres away for easy access to London for site seeing. Just down the road is a great Vietnamese restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “affordable trip to the capital”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: I booked the premier inn in hammersmith as part of a weekend in the capital for my girlfriends birthday. The location is great, 5 minute walk from ravencourt park tube station on the Piccadilly and District lines. The room was small, but nicely set up, comfy bed, tv, aircon etc. The Price including their full english breakfast was around £120, which I thought was a bit steep, but factor in the cost of parking in London then maybe its not so bad. Ill use it again most likely. Air con unit was a bit rattly and noisy, didnt effect a reasonable nights sleep though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money given its London with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Premier Inn seam to go out of there way to make you happy. Every person who works at this place is positive and works very hard to provide a good level of service. The hotel itself is what i would call up market budget, the rooms are fine. small but with king size bed's that are very comfortable indeed All the normal tea making facilities. The shampoo and hand wash is provided in a dispenser which is obviously functional of which i have no criticism as many budget hotels provide this but you should be aware if you like those little items bring them yourself. The rooms have carpeted floors, i don't personally like this however the rooms are clean and sound insulation very good indeed. If you get on high floors the views are great. Bathrooms are rather basic but functional. Location is super, easy to get to central london which is really a short walk to Ravenscourt Park underground on the District Line. Great selection of restaurants around the hotel and shops so in terms of location super. I travel from Brussels and take the Hammersmith and City Line to Hammersmith then i change to the district line. I tell you this because if you are travelling with bags this is a far easier journey than taking the Piccadilly Line which involves a considerable walk at Kings x. Since my first visit at the Premier Inn i have booked to stay several times and each time i have been totally satisfied. Well worth paying the small uplift to allow you to cancel your reservation or change it for those like me who are doing business.

Reviews.Title: “My first stay at a Premier Inn”
Reviews.Author: John J C
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. Very convenient location. Staff are very polite and helpful from time of arrival to date of departure. Would highly recommend to family and friends and will very likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “really great”
Reviews.Author: sara c
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel and found it very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The best yet !!”
Reviews.Author: nikksie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as it was close to Hammersmith Apollo for a concert. On arrival we were greeted by extremely friendly and helpful staff on reception, realising we where going to an event they offered to order a cab, very thoughtful. We decided to go by tube as the nearest station is nearby. Our room (108) was clean and comfortble and very quiet. We had a meal in the restaurant before we left and this was excellent. We both agreed that we had a great nights sleep. Had the full english option at breakfast and really enjoyed it, again friendly and helpful staff attending to us. We have stayed in Premiers all over the south of England and have to say this one was the best so far. We will definately stay in this hotel again and would have no hesitation recommending others to use it, well done.

Reviews.Title: “A touch out of the way but great hotel amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: daveur
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is not a great location for Excell exhibitions, it is close to a tube station and has great staff working

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: 23bubu
Reviews.Content: Underground station only 5 minutes walking distance. Good clean rooms and bathrooms. Safe location, with multiple cchoices of eateries withn 1 km distance. Good sounproofing in the rooms. Pleasant and courteous staff, always helpful. Takes only 10-15 minutes to London central. Definitely will recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for London access; washbasins for midgets?!?”
Reviews.Author: Claire R
Reviews.Content: We chose this Premier Inn so that we could visit London without having to catch the late train home. It's really conveniently located and great for a quick tube ride into town. Clean room, good parking and helpful staff. HOWEVER..... a little 'but', and a very strange one at that... The wash hand basins are teeny, the size you might expect in a caravan. This alone is not a deal-breaker, but there is a glass shelf mounted directly above the sink. This renders it completely useless for anything other than a quick hand wash. Washing your face is absolutely impossible without cracking your eyebrow on the edge of the shelf. Also, I note that some other reviewers rated the view, we missed out on this in room 101, so next time would ask for a higher floor. We will definitely stay here again, but take face wipes with us! These Premier Inns are far better appointed than Travel Lodges. A quick tip, skip the overpriced and very standard breakfast and nip down the road to the Hampshire Hog. Full English at £10 isn't cheap but is extremely good. Papers, a relaxed atmosphere, and fabulous wholesome choices. If we had been staying longer, we would have liked to go back here again for another meal.

Reviews.Title: “First stay but definitely not the last!”
Reviews.Author: germanbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: I tried this PremierInn for my short trip to London this time. Due to the good reviews, also about other PremierInns I always wanted to try one myself. It was everything I hoped for. An extraordinary friendly staff, you felt welcome the minute you walked in, all very safe (Lift only to operate with key card) and clean. Comfy beds and room size big enough. Another big plus is the perfect location of this property. It may not be the nicest PremierInn from the outside, but the surrounding area is quiet, clean and we felt safe at all times. Hammersmith Station is within walking distance, and if you don't feel like it, just take the bus in front of the hotel. You can even ride directly into Kensington high street without changing buses! There's a little 24/7 market across the street and a nice cafe next to it. The cab ride to LHR was only 28 Pounds so with 4 people in the car it was so worth it. No schlepping around the full suitcases. I recommended the hotel already and for me it was definitely not the last stay here. Thanks and see you soon....

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a visit to London”
Reviews.Author: Nottingham_Geyser
Reviews.Content: This is not your run of the mill Premier Inn as it is located in a tower block of about 12 floors. Stayed in a family room with two adults and two children on the 9th floor. On arrival the children's beds were already made up (take note, Travelodge!) and the room and bathroom was spotlessly clean. There were great views over London which were even better at night when everything was lit up. The breakfast buffet was excellent and staff were unwaveringly friendly and courteous. The hotel is handy for Earl's Court and is only about 200 yards away from Ravenscourt Park station on the District Line, so access to public transport is very easy. Highly recommended and would have no hesitation in using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great location very good staff.”
Reviews.Author: bridget s
Reviews.Content: we arrived in from gatwick around 12.15 at ravenscourt tube all in journey from airport to hotel via train/tube took 1hr 20mins.[ this incuded queueing for tickets at victoria ] hotel staff welcomed us and allowed us to leave luggage as it was too early for check in . this hotel is in great location for riverside studios-20 mins walk at your leisure . we met up with family for sat night and managed to book extra room at 4.30.fri. only available room was disabled 4th floor. staff were excellent cheerful and helpful. familyslept in 9th floor. w.e used 4th floor. the rooms were fine beds clean n comfortable used premier often quality budget hotel £82 for twin room £96 for disabled. sun night used 9th floor as family returned home views from 4th floor upwards. we dined in a fantastic italian restraunt -Capri- food was first class (Holcombe st. off king st.) look out for irish trad. musicians on sundays at HAMMERSMITH N RAM PUB on kings st. nice n relaxing. will go again.!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, cost effective stay”
Reviews.Author: stuartmarler
Reviews.Content: A great location hotel, very clean, comfortable, good facilities, great breakfast and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “London made easy”
Reviews.Author: asseret64
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights going to Hyde Park for concerts. The booking in was easy and luckily we managed to get a parking place. The room we had was on the 9th floor and it was great looked over the Thames could see the London Eye etc. The room was clean and very modern. Breakfast was lovely everything was available and it was all fresh and hot what else could you need. Staff very pleasant. Location for London was great tube or buses available from outside, Tesco down the road if you do forget anything.

Reviews.Title: “Proprio quello che cercavo...Just what I was looking for...:-)”
Reviews.Author: Stefy131267
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Premier Inn Hammersmith from the 13th to the 16th october for a long weekend. The hotel is very nice. We had a double bedroom at the 10th floor which is amazing because you have the whole view of London in front of you and a large window. The bedroom and the toilet were very clean even though there was the carpet as you can expect in every bedroom in London. The bedroom is not very very big, just appropriate to sleep and then leave early in the morning to walk and visit this fantastic city. It' s true that breakfast is not included in the price and that to have a full continental and english breakfast is 8.50 pounds more but it's worth because after that full breakfast you can probably skip your lunch. I didn't pay 29 pounds per nights as someone over there informed me that it can be if you reserve in advance of a few months, but I also know hotels in London are very expensive, unless you want to sleep in a very dirty place. Even though it is not in area 1 it is very close to the subway and in 15 minutes you get to Vicotria Station. The staff is fantastic, nice and kind. I remember Celso, his name on the badge, he was very very nice to prepare for us a "grab and go " breakfast the day of our departure since we left very early. I will return here, maybe a little bit cheaper for me it would be better, but I striclty recommend you.

Reviews.Title: “worth the money for the view alone”
Reviews.Author: STEVEN C
Reviews.Content: As premier inns go this was quite nice, i was on the 12th floor so i had an amazing view of the thames and the city, right next to ravenscourt park tube station so was great for access to the city

Reviews.Title: “Good value, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: 64rg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night for a concert at the Hammersmith Apollo (subsequently cancelled due to a burst water main!). From the point of arrival onwards the service was first class, all the staff were friendly and welcoming. Yes, the room was small as others have stated but the beds were extremely comfortable and it was very quiet. It was also scrupulously clean. We were on the eighth floor and had a great view across London which was a bonus! The shower was good, there seemed to be limitless hot water and the all you can eat breakfast was excellent. The hotel is a good 15 minute walk from Hammersmith tube, however it is literally 2 minutes from Ravenscourt Park. This was our first stay at a Premier Inn and I expected it to be similar in quality to a Travelodge. I can safely say it was significantly better in all areas!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: aesalem
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights at King's Street, Hammersmith, London's Premier Inn. Although it was a little bit expensive viz £100/night, the WiFi was not free and you needed to buy a voucher, and the breakfast was not free as well, overall the staff was friendly and helpful, the room was well-maintained, and the beds were really comfy. I'd recommend it for a short-stay and for a couple at max. especially since the rooms are really small. On a scale from one to ten, I'd give it a 7-8/10

Reviews.Title: “Good location, breakfast, super comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: homiediel
Reviews.Content: Room was pretty small, but clean. Breakfast was ok, but if you wanted bacon and eggs ect. you had to pay extra, which was pretty stupid I think. In our bathroom there was no shower drain, so you can imagine how the bathroom floor was filled with water everytime we showered. The location was better than I thought. Two subway stations are pretty near. There are shops and good restaurants and pubs also near by. Super comfortable bed. This hotel is better than avarege hotels in London.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: CardiffBluebird77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really good location and & quick tube ride to the heart of London. There are great bars & restaurants nearby, plus you have the river just a 5 minutes walk away. The actual hotel is good inside, however the room are really small. I have stayed in about 8 premier inns & all had spacious rooms. However, our room was tiny & very humid. We finally discovered how to open the window & let some air in. The bathroom was also compact. There did give you a fan to have on, but this didn't help much. I would say this building was an old office block & I doubt that i would stay again, a shame really.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location - a bargain at £39/night for our family.”
Reviews.Author: benb3342
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the bank holiday weekend, and the room was nice and clean and the hotel very well run. We used the car park (£15 for 24hrs), and had breakfast each day. We also had dinner one night. Family room was great, a good size and clean and comfy. Hotel is a couple of minutes walk from the Ravenscourt Tube station, on the District Line, which took about 15 mins to get to Westminster. Ravenscourt Park is opposite, and good for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Andy G
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights here with my family and really enjoyed the experience. The Inn is situated in a nice, quiet part of London and only a short walk from Ravenscourt tube station. The Hotel is very clean and modern and the room we had (508) was lovely. The room was plenty big enough, the kids had their own single beds, the main bed was large (2 singles together) and there was a TV, hairdryer, kettle etc. The staff were really friendly and helpful, optional breakfast was plentiful and very tasty and the bar functional. There is a Tesco express a few minutes walk away and a 24/7 convenience store across the road. I would recommend this Inn and very impressed with my first stay in a Premier Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for tube into London - quiet area.”
Reviews.Author: MELISSA N
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the Hammersmith Premier Inn with 4 adults & 1 child. Excellent location for tube station as 2 mins away. & only 20 mins into central London. Travelling by car from the North (Grimsby) & very easy to find. Lovely area with lots of restaurants etc but fairly quiet near the Hotel. Top floors have spectacular view across London, so worth asking for at reception. Very clean, polite staff & we were lucky to obtain a car parking space. Definately would come back here when visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “a stressful stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynne030
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Premier Inns before and were disappointed with this experience. The room we were given , on the tenth floor, was not big and did not have a king size bed. The toilet had been used and not flushed or cleaned. Furthermore the air conditioning was not working properly. There was a fan provided by the hotel which was clunky when we tried to use it. We were staying there at the end of June when the weather was very hot. After a very hot night the reply from reception was that they would look into it. When we arrived back in the afternoon from with an evening engagement ahead of us nothing had been done. We were even told that the problem was because we should be leaving curtains closed at all times so that no sun should get in. After three visits to reception they admitted that our air conditioning was not functioning and they changed us to another room. By this time we were late for our next engagement and arrived there stressed. The second room was clean, a good size and everything functioned perfectly and we would have been very happy there at the start, which is why I have rated the hotel with three stars. I had difficulty complaining to Premier Inn as the website only worked if you provided a British postal code. In the end I just put in a British postal code instead of a NZ code. The hotel chain have now honoured their good night's sleep guarantee.

Reviews.Title: “1st timers”
Reviews.Author: Patricia1572
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideal for visiting the sites of london. The family room was adequate for 2 adults and a child and was very clean with good air con. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - first class service”
Reviews.Author: joc_copy
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room for two nights. Room was large, big bathroom and was spotless. Staff lovely and the place is immaculate. We ate in both nights - food was good and the breakfasts excellent value. Not bad at all for getting about London and it's in a lovely tranquil area. Thoroughly enjoyed out stay there - had a fab time seeing the sights and then collapsing in the comfort of this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: jaggles
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited our needs perfectly. Very close to Ravenscourt tube station and access to all the sights. Close to heathrow. Secure parking with CCTV coverage at a reasonable cost. Room as you'd expect, clean with everything you need. Breakfast great with excellent service, good service from reception staff. Overall a happy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent facilities, family friendly & good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Irene D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Premier Inn in Hammersmith with my 2 children and was satisfied with the hotel. The accommodation was very good, clean and tidy room and large enough for a family of 4 with good bathroom facilities. The food was excellent and reasonably priced - the steak was to die for and cooked to perfection! Ideal location for getting around London with good selection of shops nearby and tube station a short walk away and regular bus services. Staff were very professional and friendly and in general the hotel is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with overall standard”
Reviews.Author: PooleBesty
Reviews.Content: We did get this room at a sale rate and so only paid £39 for it. But the family room was plenty large enough, very clean and comfortable. A good location for central London, and also Ravenscort tube station. We drove and they wanted to charge £15 for a very small car park, but if you arrive after 6pm parking restrictions in the nearby streets are suspended. We found a space quite easily. Nice park opposite the hotel to have a walk in. Staff were very friendly, and professional. Check in and out both quick and easy. Breakfast excellent, and good value if you have children as they eat free. Staff at breakfast deserve extra mention for being fast, friendly and keeping the breakfast items continually toppped up, which was not easy as it was busy. This hotel is also on the Heathrow flight path, but you could not hear anything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short London break.”
Reviews.Author: YeovilWuppy
Reviews.Content: Brought the grandchildren here with my husband for a weekend break. The hotel was spotlessly clean, and our room was enormous, with a super king sized bed and two singles. The bathroom was bigger than anywhere we have stayed before. The breakfast was great value for money, especially as both of the children ate free! I would recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a value weekend. Although not in the centre of London the hotel was only a few minutes from Ravenscourt Park Station, on the District Line and buses passed by the hotel too. The children thought it was great and especially enjoyed Ravenscourt Park just across the road. The staff were both courteous and helpful and were fantastic with the children. The only critisism I have is that perhaps a bell could be installed in the reception area when it is unmanned as we had to wait some minutes for someone to deal with us when it was time to check out. In all aspects a thoroughly enjoyable stay. Congratulations to all of the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: PaulFincken1972
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many premier inns around the country and have always had excellent service and experiences. Therefore when I was visiting Twickenham I immediately booked a premier inn near the ground. The hotel appeared in good shape and actually thought from appearance in reception and the room it was probably the best we had stayed in. However, I found the service quite disappointing. We booked a meal for 8pm. We arrived early after coming back from Twickenham and got to the restaurant at 7.45pm. We ordered about 5 minutes later. From where we were sat we could see the meals at the serving hatch. The first meal was placed on the tray, but did not arrive at the table for approx 5 minutes along with two of the other meals. The fourth meal came 5 minutes after this. Whilst we were eating, the waitress started taking plates away while others were still eating - poor etiquette. Next morning, housekeeping tried to clean the rooms at 8.30am while we were still preparing to go for breakfast. Considering check out time is 12, very annoying. Again at breakfast, plates were taken from our table while people were still eating. Overall a disappointing experience after a good weekend of visiting Twickenham to see England v Wales. We use the hotels regular. I am rugby referee and travel around the country and book a premier in the city nearest to where I am. I have also used Beckton in London for visits to the West End. I now expect a high standard from the Premier Inn when I stay based on the experiences so far......however this has changed my perception and hope this is not experienced again.

Reviews.Title: “It was lucky to find this nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: antomol
Reviews.Content: This was my first contact with Premier Inn hotels. Very positive experience. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Standard for a Premier inn - but loud kids”
Reviews.Author: alwyn1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times. The rooms are clean and what you would expect from a budget hotel. They have recently been upgrading and decorating rooms and have not yet finished. The double rooms are quite spacious with king sized bed and bath with shower over it. If you are looking for a single room, expect a very small room with a three quarter sized bed and shower cubicle that is so tiny that you can hardly turn around in it, and I'm not a large person . This hotel caters for large groups of young foreign students visiting London. They can be very loud in the restaurant in the morning and in the evening with very little supervision from their teachers or the Premier Inn staff who seem oblivious to the noise or the comfort of other hotel guests. They can also be a problem running up and down corridors late at night and shouting at the top of their voice. The sevice in the restaurant is normally OK with friendly staff, but I along with a few others did walk out on one occasion in the evening after waiting 45 minutes without even being asked if I required a drink! Some others had been in there an hour and had only had their starters. There is a small car park at the rear with a few spaces at the front for disabled parking. There is a charge for parking, so check the price before you book. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to Hammersmith underground station.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Ravenscourt station and very friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: tishusa
Reviews.Content: very nice,excellent breakfast and helpful staff.moved me to a larger room because ofa problem with the toilet. Was glad to be in a double because the single would have been very cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Good for central London and Earls Court”
Reviews.Author: Tom_G_47
Reviews.Content: Overall a good stay, especially enjoyed the breakfasts. Room very clean and recently refurbished. Do bare in mind though that it is an old building and as such the standard rooms are tiny in comparison with newer Premier inns. The rooms did get very hot and the air conditioning needs upgrading - quite noisy and less effective than an asthmatic ant with some heavy shopping. It seems a shame to have to keep the curtains closed all day to stop the room turning into a green house (we were on the 10th floor and had a super view). Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but just for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: rabumbl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Premier Inn with friends the first time. Price, stars and location persuaded us to pick this hotel. In general, we have not been disappointed. Ok, but just for a weekend. Location is fantastic, right next to the River Thames, lots of original pubs and breweries. And even the Hammersmith tube station is not far away (10 - 15 minutes on foot ). Room cleanness overall was acceptable for a 3 star hotel. Room was very tight, too tight, but for two days still ok. The bathroom looked newly tiled. Standard bath furniture, everything unbroken and clean. However, being 6.1 ft tall, it took some time to get a shower, anything but enjoyable: shower head not adjustable in height, so that I had to uncomfortably bend over while hair washing. Ceiling height was much too low, made me feel a bit under pressure. Bed was too short for regular European people caused mainly by an overhanging part of the wall at the head of the bed leaving just a few inches of head room. Fortunately, the bed could be easily pulled forward. Matressee was rather comfortable compared with all the other hotel matressees I can remember of. Carpet has already lived its live. Since a nice carpet deals as a sort of highlight of a room, in terms of customers' satisfaction I think a new one would really pay off. TV was fantastic. Big flat screen with a perfectly clear picture. Plus point. Windows' quality was a bit disappointing. Old glas, broken and ugly looking window frames. Durty little chamber in front of the window. The view, however, towards the London skyline (from the 11 th floor or so) is breathtaking. Never seen anything comparable. This view has risen my overall rating. The 12th floor too kept most noise to a minimum yet there is lots of traffic all around the hotel and clock. Receptionists and all the other staff were very kind and forthcoming. Breakfast was ok, the usual. The price, well, compared with similar hotels and locations in London, I must say, it is slightly unappropriate. 15 pounds cheaper and breakfast included would fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: runray2000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Premier Inn at Hammersmith, and felt that it was only fair to give a review. In terms of location for Central London, it was easily accessible by the tube despite engineering works over the weekend. We had an easy check in, and on the day we decided to have breakfast we received an excellent personal service which is so rare at a hotel which is part of a chain, as well as the food being of a good standard. Our room was quite small, but that is only to expected in London, and the view from the 12th floor over the city was great. The room was also clean, and I slept well on both nights. There are also many amenities nearby in the local area, such as a supermarket, pubs and restaurants!! Thank you for your excellent service, and I will certainly consider staying here again when in London!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for London”
Reviews.Author: R-RYD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights, arrived a couple hours before check in and was given a room right away. The staff was always very helpful and friendly. We had an 11th floor room with a great view of the surrounding area. Breakfast was very good as were the couple dinners we ate here. There are plenty of restaurants within a short walking distance, a 24 HR market right across the street and Ravenscourt Tube (zone2) was less than a 5 minute walk. The location and reasonable price really makes it a great base for exploring London and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and will definitely recommend it and stay again there”
Reviews.Author: shz333
Reviews.Content: Very quiet, peaceful area. Near to tube station (2 min walk), bus stop just outside hotel. Lies in Zone 2. A lot of Indian & Halal meat serving restaurants nearby. Breathtaking city views, specially river Thames, if you are staying at higher floors. Excellent breakfast. Value for money. Book well in advance to get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - will definitely use again”
Reviews.Author: IainFlemingFalkirk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of an overnight Theatre trip. I initially tried to book the Premier Inn Victoria, which is just around the corner from the theatre, but it was fully booked. This was a very good alternative, although it did involve travel on the Tube. The hgotel is just a couple of minutes walk from Ravenscourt Park(District line) and the room was excellent. Air Conditioning and an extra fan - this was the hottest and muggiest day of the year - were much appreciated and ensured we had a comfortable night. The views from the 12th floor were excellent and the bed was exceptionally comfortable. Service and food in the restaurant were also very good indeed and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: cparkyuk
Reviews.Content: Just stayed two nights, room was nice and clean, good double glazing couldn't hear any traffic. Ravenspark tube station is just 2 minutes away. Didn't eat in the hotel went to a little Italian next door which filled us up. Nice comfy bed and fluffy pillows, looks like some of the rooms are being refurbished, we didn't hear any noise though. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myopinionWales
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just after Christmas 2010 and I wrote in my review at the time that we had been disappointed at various problems with the room and service. We stayed again on Whitsun Bank Holiday as we were in London for Swansea's football play off final at Wembley, and it was a much improved experience. We had two nicely refurbished rooms for the family with good views across London. The staff were friendly and helpful, for instance when we asked for more teabags and milk in the room. We didn't eat at the hotel in the evening, but again enjoyed the Indian Zing restaurant almost opposite. It's the best Indian restaurant I have tried, and several of our fellow guests felt the same. We had the full breakfast in the morning and our young daughter could eat free. It was good and plentiful and set us up well for the day. We could leave our car in the hotel car park all day and picked it up after the match. Hammersmith is a pleasant area to stay, and the hotel was handy for the M4 and underground links. We reached Wembley easily and quickly even though it is the other side of the city. It was a good stay, and even more importantly Swansea won the final!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base to stay”
Reviews.Author: TheDoctorG
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very good base to see friends around Chiswick, Hammersmith & Richmond. Easy access via tube & bus and it proved a good option for the low price. Rooms were clean but small, however the views from ours were rather impressive across a good chunk of London. Staff were all friendly, especially and surprisingly at breakfast and were helpful, especially when I needed guidance for bus, etc. Breakfast was very nice, proper english (sadly no black pudding!) but filled me up nicely until lunch. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a weekend in London!”
Reviews.Author: Timmy1986
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed at a Premier Inn before, I was a little nervous as I booked the hotel as part of a West End Theatre break. I needn't have been nervous. It was a wonderful place to stay. Greeted by a giant Purple tower block, me and my girlfriend walked into the reception and were instantly greeted by a smile by the friendly reception staff. There was a slight delay with checking us in as we had booked via a thrid party group but it was quickly resolved and were given a room on the 11th floor which had stunning views over London. Highly recommend getting a room on a higher floor for this reason. The room was a great size for a London hotel, it was clean, very comfortable with a lovely bath/shower room also very clean and well kept. Also had a small LCD freeview TV and a lovely letter from the general manager offering extra sheets instead of duvets because of the hot weather (as well as air con and available fans). There was no noise from other rooms and if you have the window open you will get some noise, but with it being on the outskirts of London its far, far less than normal. It was a perfect room for us, we couldnt have been happier. We had continental breakfast on the first day which was a great selection of cereals, pastries, yoghurts, fruits and toast, with plenty of hot and cold drinks all constantly topped up. The staff were very friendly and explained where everything was. We paid for an upgrade to a full English breakfast plus continental if we wanted and that was also lovely. Freshly cooked breakfast which was very tasty. We didnt have dinner or lunch there so cant comment on that, but the small but inviting dinner area was nice and the food set us both up for our sightseeing days. Ravenscourt Park tube station is just a couple of minutes walk away and is ideal for getting to the sights of London without being stuck in the middle of busy central London. The Hammersmith/Ravenscourt Park area is perfect to escape too after the noise and hustle and bustle of London. Overall there is nothing to fault about this hotel and we will most certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fit the bill”
Reviews.Author: polarbearcub
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of location and because they have a ramp to enter. Also the reviews seemed promising and the price was okay. It was all of those things. I did miss free wi-fi, but also did get online from my room, mostly in the night; otherwise the signals were too poor. The room was small, but that was a fair trade off. I tried to use the TV, but there was some extra arrangement with a switch that I didn't find out about until late in my visit. I never did turn it on. It's not a fancy hotel, but it seems to check all the right boxes for me. Never did eat there. There's a lot of restaurants and shopping nearby. When I needed help, reception was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel and we'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: kipper48
Reviews.Content: The staff here are very helpful and nothing seems to be too much trouble. Breakfast was exceptionally good value with an excellent choice to suit everyone, including vegetarians - and children eat free!! It's near a tube station so a great base for whatever you want to do in London.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel I have ever stayed in London!”
Reviews.Author: CathDids
Reviews.Content: I have been used to impersonal and unfriendly service in London hotels, even in 4* ones, so I was pleasantly surprised to arrive to such lovely, friendly and helpful staff. I was visiting London with my 3 daughters, aged 7 to 11, having left my husband and son to do their own thing at home. They made our stay as easy and comfortable as possible, were lovely when my 9 year old dropped her orange juice over the breakfast table and chair and really, nothing was too much trouble for them. I was delighted to be able to leave our bags with them on the last day after check out instead of lugging it all to left luggage at Euston station. I will definitely use this hotel again: it was clean, comfortable and the rooms were spacious. The breakfast was lovely too, and really set us up for the day. 11/10!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay overall”
Reviews.Author: PreacherKane
Reviews.Content: Check-in was very good; all information was provided for me and the ladies on the front desk demonstrated good local knowledge of bus and train routes, furnishing me with maps and directions accordingly - professional and efficient service. The nearest tube is Ravenscourt Park (a minute over the road then next left) but the walk down to Hammersmith tube (for Hammersmith/City plus Circle lines) was only 10 mins straight down the main road. The lift and stairs both use the room keycard for entry, although the doorlock on the stairs wasn't mounted correctly and handle obstruction meant I never got my card to work in it. There are a small number of car parking spaces at the front and a larger car park around the back; whilst it's not free (I think I was quoted £15/night) the barrier does offer some level of protection. Room was clean and functional and tidied every day without fail. One of the secondary-glazed windows had come off its runner and was difficult to slide but the windows kept most noise to a minimum and the aircon/heating kept the room at a suitable temperature. Most noise I encountered was from neighbouring rooms; nonetheless I had a good kip for all nights. As with most Premier Inns, internet access isn't free.
